channel.title: [Tutorial] Editing EasyRSC
channel.description:
I am basically posting this to try and prevent some of the self explanatory questions that generally appear daily on the forums. People don't like searching, so if the basic things can be thrown in 1 topic, it may be quicker for them to find, and prevent the hideously basic questions on a daily basis.
If you edit a JAVA file, then [b]COMPILE[/b]!
If you edit a XML file, then [b]COMPRESS[/b]!
If you edit a RSCD file, [b]DESCOMPRESS[/b], [b]EDIT[/b] and then [b]COMPRESS[/b]!
[b]Required Programs:[/b]
EasyRSC Source 1: http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,340170.0.html
If the above download links do not work for you, then click this link:
EasyRSC Source 2: http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,362098.0.html
Compression Tool: http://uppit.com/v/PDY8ODN3
7-zip: http://www.7-zip.org/download.html
Sprite Editor, Packer/Unpacker: http://uppit.com/RHTW0V
[b]Editing Items[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Defs
Once in the Defs folder, find and open your ItemsDef.xml file.
[code] <name>ITEM NAME</name> [/code]
This will change the name of the Item.
[code] <description>DESCRIPTION WHEN EXAMINE IS CLICKED</description> [/code]
This will change the description of the item, when the player right clicks it and clicks on the examine option.
[code] <command></command> [/code]
This is if you want the item to have a command. For example: If you item was a book and you wanted an option to read the book, you would use:
[code] <command>Read</command> [/code]
[code] <sprite>SPRITE IMAGE ID</sprite> [/code]
This determines what the inventory image will be.
[code] <basePrice>1000</basePrice> [/code]
The baseprice determines how much the shops will sell the item for. If you're selling the item to the shop, you will get half of the baseprice. For example: If the shop sells an item for 1,000 coins, you will only be able to sell that item to the shop for 500 coins.
[code] <stackable>false</stackable> [/code]
This makes the item [b]not[/b] stackable. This means that the items will take up more than 1 space in your inventory. Such as armour or weapons.
[code] <stackable>true</stackable> [/code]
This [b]WILL[/b] make the item stackable. This means that the item will only take up 1 space in your inventory. Such as runes or certificates.
[code] <wieldable>false</wieldable> [/code]
This makes the item [b]NOT[/b] wieldable.
[code] <wieldable>true</wieldable> [/code]
This will make the item wieldable. However, to actually wield the item, you need to add it into the ItemWieldableDef.xml file.
[code] <pictureMask>65535</pictureMask> [/code]
This will determine what the colour of the item is when displayed in your inventory. If you don't want to change the colour of the item and just use the exact colour from the image in the sprites, just use the picture mask as "0".
[b]Editing NPCs[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Defs
Once in the Defs folder, find and open your NPCDef.xml file.
[code] <name>NPC NAME</name> [/code]
This will determine the name of the NPC.
[code] <description>NPC DESCRIPTION</description> [/code]
This will be displayed to describe the NPC when you right click and examine it.
[code] <attack>ATTACK LEVEL</attack> <strength>STRENGTH LEVEL</strength> <hits>HIT POINTS</hits> <defense>DEFENSE LEVEL</defense> [/code]
This will determine the stats of the NPC. The NPCs combat level will be automatically calculated depending what the NPCs stats are.
[code] <attackable>true</attackable> [/code]
This will make it so that you [b]CAN[/b] attack the NPC. If you want the NPC [b]NOT[/b] to be attackable, use:
[code] <attackable>false</attackable> [/code]
[code] <aggressive>true</aggressive> [/code]
This will make the NPC aggressive. This means that if a player walks near that NPC, the NPC will automatically attack that player. To make it so that the NPC doesn't automatically attack, use:
[code] <aggressive>false</aggressive> [/code]
[code] <respawnTime>500</respawnTime> [/code]
This will determine the length of time for an NPC to respawn. The lower the number, the quicker the NPC will respawn.
[code] <drops> <ItemDropDef> <id>ITEM ID</id> <amount>AMOUNT TO DROP</amount> <weight>0</weight> </ItemDropDef> </drops> [/code]
This part determines what items the NPC will drop. The weight determines the drop rate. It can be quite tricky to get drop rates [b]PERFECTLY[/b], so work with it and test them out. If the weight is "0", that will be a 100% drop rate.
[b]Editing wieldable Items[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Defs -- Extras
Once in the Defs folder, find and open your ItemWieldableDef.xml file.
[code] <int>0</int> [code]
This corresponds to the item ID. For example: If you're looking for the Rune 2-handed Sword, search for:
[code] <int>81</int> [/code]
[code] <sprite>SPRITE NUMBER</sprite> [/code]
This will determine what sprite is used for what item.
[code] <type>ITEM TYPE</type> [/code]
This will determine what type the item is.
[code] <wieldPos>WIELD POSITION</wieldPos> [/code]
This will determine where abouts on your player the item will be made wieldable to.
[code] <armourPoints>0</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>0</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>0</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> [/code]
These determine the amount of bonus to be added to the item.
[code] <requiredStats> <entry> <int>STAT ID</int> <int>REQUIRED LEVEL</int> </entry> </requiredStats> [/code]
This will determine if the item requires any specific stats to wield it.
[b]Here is a list of the stat IDs:[/b]
0 = Attack 1 = Defense 2 = Strength 3 = Hits 4 = Ranged 5 = Prayer 6 = Magic 7 = Cooking 8 = Woodcut 9 = Fletching 10 = Fishing 11 = Firemaking 12 = Crafting 13 = Smithing 14 = Mining 15 = Herblaw 16 = Agility 17 = Thieving
[code] <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly> [/code]
This will determine what gender character can wear that item. If this is false, this means that both male and female characters can use this item. To make it so that only females are able to use the item, use:
[code] <femaleOnly>true</femaleOnly> [/code]
[b]Changing the location of an NPC[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Locs
Once in the Locs folder, find and open your NpcLoc.xml file.
[code] <id>NPC ID</id> [/code]
This is where you add the ID for the NPC.
[code] <startX>START X COORD</startX> <startY>START Y COORD</startY> [/code]
This will determine the coordinates of where you want your NPC to start from.
[code] <minX>MINIMUM X COORD</minX> <maxX>MAXIMUM X COORD</maxX> [/code]
This will determine the minimum and maximum X coordinate that your NPC can move to.
[code] <minY>MINIMUM Y COORD</minY> <maxY>MAXIMUM Y COORD</maxY> [/code]
This will determine the minimum and maximum Y coordinate that your NPC can move to.
[b]Changing the item Locations[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Locs
Once in the Locs folder, find and open your ItemLoc.xml file.
In this file, this basically determines what items are spawned across the world.
[code] <id>81</id> [/code]
This will be the ID of the item you want to place at set coordinates.
[code] <x>X COORD</x> <y>Y COORD</y> [/code]
This will be the coordinate location of the item spawn.
[code] <amount>1</amount> [/code]
This will determine how many of a specific item to spawn at the set coordinates.
[code] <respawnTime>60</respawnTime> [/code]
This determines the length of time it takes for the item to respawn after it's been picked up.
[b]Changing the object Locations[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in your server folder, go into:
Conf -- Server -- Locs
Once in the Locs folder, find and open your GameObjectLoc.xml file.
In this file, this basically determines what objects are spawned across the world.
[code] <id>OBJECT ID</id> [/code]
This will be the ID of the object you want to place.
[code] <x>X COORD</x> <y>Y COORD</y> [/code]
This will determine the location of the object on the world.
[code] <direction>0</direction> [/code]
This will determine the direction of the object.
Please note: Anything changed in the .xml files will need to be compressed using either the Compression Tool or 7-zip. You will also need to edit files client side in order for the edits to work correctly.
Below shows which files server side corresponds to which file client side.
[code] ItemsDef.xml (server side) Items.rscd (client side) [/code]
[code] GameObjectDef.xml (server side) Objects.rscd (client side) [/code]
[code] NpcDef.xml (server side) NPCs.rscd (client side) [/code]
[code] PrayerDef.xml (server side) Prayers.rscd (client side) [/code]
[code] SpellDef.xml (server side) Spells.rscd (client side) [/code]
[b]Changing the death Location[/b]
To change the death location, go into the Server folder. Once in the server folder, go to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Server -- Model
Once in the model folder, right click and open the Player.java file with any text editing program. Once open, find:
[code] setLocation(Point.location(122, 647), true); [/code]
Change the X and Y coordinates to the new spawn location.
X coordinate = 122 Y coordinate = 647
[b]Changing the welcome Messages (when logging in)[/b]
Go into the Client folder. Once in the client folder, go to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Client
Once in the client folder, right click and open the mudclient.java file with any text editing programs, such as notepad or wordpad. Once open, search for:
[code] gameGraphics.drawText("Welcome to RSCDaemon " + currentUser, 256, j, 4, 0xffff00); [/code]
Change the blue highlighted text to your server name.
[b]Changing the welcome Messages (on the login screem)[/b]
Go into the Client folder. Once in the client folder, go to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Client
Once in the client folder, right click and open the mudclient.java file with any text editing programs, such as notepad or wordpad. Once open, search for:
[code] menuWelcome.drawText(256, 200 + i, "Welcome to RSCDaemon", 4, true); menuWelcome.drawText(256, 215 + i, "For support please visit www.rscdaemon.org", 4, true); [/code]
Change the "RSCDaemon" text to your server name. Also, change the "www.rscdaemon.org" text to the URL of your servers forums/site.
[img]http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/5606/screenshot0.png[/img]
[b]Adding information to the Client[/b]
Go into the Client folder. Once in the client folder, go to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Client
Once in the client folder, right click and open the mudclient.java file with any text editing programs, such as notepad or wordpad. Once open, search for:
[code] gameGraphics.drawText("System update in: " + j8 + ":" + i6, 256, windowHeight - 7, 1, 0xffff00); } [/code]
Directly under that, add:
[code] gameGraphics.drawString("@gre@Username: @whi@" + ourPlayer.name + "", 5, 130 + 10, 1, 0xffffff); gameGraphics.drawString("@gre@Combat Level: @whi@" + ourPlayer.level + "", 5, 143 + 10, 1, 0xffffff); gameGraphics.drawString("@gre@Coords: (X: @whi@" + (sectionX + areaX) + "@gre@, Y: @whi@" + (sectionY + areaY) + "@gre@)", 5, 156 + 10, 1, 0xffffff); gameGraphics.drawString("@gre@Prayer: @whi@" + playerStatCurrent[5] + "@gre@/@whi@" + playerStatBase[5] + "", 5, 169 + 10, 1, 0xffffff); gameGraphics.drawString("@gre@Fatigue: @whi@" + fatigue + "@gre@%", 5, 182 + 10, 1, 0xffffff); [/code]
Here is what it will look like:
[img]http://img61.imageshack.us/img61/9100/screenshot4p.png[/img]
[b]Buying Commands[/b]
Go into your server folder. Once in there, go to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Server -- Packethandler -- Client
Once in the client folder, right click and open the CommandHandler.java file with a text editing program.
Here is how every command will start off:
[code] if(cmd.equals("NAME OF COMMAND")) { [/code]
Now, for the name of command, that will be the name that you want in order to execute the command. For example:
[code] if(cmd.equals("pots")) { [/code]
In order to execute that command, you would type:- ::pots
Now if you want to check the players inventory when you execute the command for a specific item and amount, then use:
[code] if(player.getInventory().countId(ITEM ID) < AMOUNT) { [/code]
An example for you:
[code] if(player.getInventory().countId(10) < 5000) { [/code]
The code above will basically check if the player has 5,000 coins or more in his/her inventory.
Now, if the player doesn't have the required amount, let's make it send a message telling them they don't have enough.
[code] if(player.getInventory().countId(10) < 5000) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need 5,000 coins to use this command!"); } [/code]
Now, once it's check if the player has the required amount of coins, you want to tell it to actually do something if they do have required amount. You also want it to remove the required item and the amount, so add:
[code] else { player.getInventory().remove(ITEM ID, AMOUNT); [/code]
Under that, you will basically write what you want it to do. For example: Adding a item to a persons inventory.
[code] player.getInventory().add(new InvItem(ITEM ID, AMOUNT)); [/code]
Once you've told it what item and the amount to add, you need to actually send the inventory:
[code] player.getActionSender().sendInventory(); } [/code]
After that, add the return:
[code] return; [/code]
So using the "pots" as an example, this would be used to buy a superset for 30,000 coins:
[code] if(cmd.equals("pots")) { if(player.getInventory().countId(10) < 30000) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need 30,000 coins to use this command"); } else { player.getInventory().remove(10, 30000); player.getInventory().add(new InvItem(486, 1)); player.getInventory().add(new InvItem(492, 1)); player.getInventory().add(new InvItem(495, 1)); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("The super set have been added to your inventory"); player.getActionSender().sendInventory(); } return; } [/code]
[b]Teleporting Commands[/b]
To teleport a player by command, use:
[code] player.teleport(X COORD, Y COORD, true); [/code]
[b]Clearing Bank Items[/b]
[code] player.getBank().getItems().clear(); [/code]
For example:
[code] if(cmd.equals("clearbank")) { player.getBank().getItems().clear(); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your bank has been cleared."); return; } [/code]
[b]Sending Messages[/b]
[code] player.getActionSender().sendMessage("MESSAGE GOES HERE"); [/code]
This can be useful when creating a command such as ::help
[b]Setting Stats[/b]
When setting stats, you want to do a few things, not just set the stat. You need to:
1. Set the current stat. This will be the number on the left side of the stat menu. Such as: "[b]1[/b]/99". 2. Set the max stat. This will be the number on the right side of the stat menu. Such as: "1/[b]99[/b]". 3. Set the EXP for the stat. This is so it will actually keep the stat when you log out. 4. Send the stat.
[code] player.setCurStat(STAT ID, LEVEL); [/code]
[code] player.setMaxStat(STAT ID, LEVEL); [/code]
[code] player.setEXP(STAT ID, AMOUNT); [/code]
[code] player.getActionSender().sendStats(); [/code]
[code] player.getActionSender().sendStat(STAT ID); [/code]
[b]Making NPC Talk[/b]
In order to make the NPCs talk, you must firstly have a java file containing the java for what you want the corresponding NPC to do. To find these, go into your server folder, and then:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Server -- Npchandler
Once in the Npchandler folder, there will be the java files for your NPCs. This is where you will add any new NPC java files. Once you have the java file in there, make note of the name of that java file.
Now, let's add that name in our npchandlers.xml file. Without this addition, the NPC will not work.
Go into your server folder, and then:
Conf -- Server
Once in the server folder, right click and open NpcHandlers.xml.
This is the basic code for adding an NPC in this file:
[code] <NpcHandler> <ids> <int>NPC ID</int> </ids> <className>org.rscdaemon.server.npchandler.FILE NAME</className> </NpcHandler> [/code]
Where I have wrote "file name", that [b]MUST[/b] be the [b]EXACT[/b] name of your java file in the npchandlers folder. For example: Adventurer.java (in the npchandlers folder) would be added by using:
[code] <NpcHandler> <ids> <int>208</int> </ids> <className>org.rscdaemon.server.npchandler.Adventurer</className> </NpcHandler> [/code]
[b]Changing the max Level[/b]
Go into your server folder, and then go in to:
Src -- Org -- Rscdaemon -- Server -- Util
Once in the util folder, right click the Formulae.java file and open it with notepad or wordpad.
Find where it strings the experience.
[code]public static final int[] experienceArray[/code]
And look at:
[code]public static final int[] eArray[/code]
That is where you will add the experience for the new caps.
Now once you've added the experience, look for:
[code] public static int experienceToLevel(int exp) { for(int level = 0; level < 98; level++) { if(exp >= experienceArray[level]) { continue; } return (level + 1); } return 99; }[/code]
Once you find that, you will need to edit the "98" and the "99". For example: If you have added experience to have a max cap of 115, change it to:
[code] public static int experienceToLevel(int exp) { for(int level = 0; level < 114; level++) { if(exp >= experienceArray[level]) { continue; } return (level + 1); } return 115; }[/code]
[img]http://img510.imageshack.us/img510/1571/screenshot118.png[/img]
[b]Changing the login Screen[/b]
First of all, if you do not have one, download the sprite editor, packer and unpacker from the link provided above in the required programs section. Once you have downloaded and extracted, open up the folder and double click on the Run Editor.bat file.
Once the editor has loaded, click on the load image button at the top and find the location of your new login image. Once you have found it, open it up into the editor.
[img]http://img56.imageshack.us/img56/333/img2a.png[/img]
Once open, click the save sprite button at the top of the editor and save your image as 3150.spr into the sprites folder.
[img]http://img220.imageshack.us/img220/1839/img1g.png[/img]
Once you have saved your image as 3150.spr in the sprites folder, double click on the Run Packer.bat file. When it pops up, locate your Sprites.rscd file (client side) and open it up to pack it. If done correctly, you should see:
[img]http://img56.imageshack.us/img56/605/img3.png[/img]
After that, load your client with the new login screen ^^
[img]http://img407.imageshack.us/img407/1220/screenshot1x.png[/img]
More coming soon.
Regards,
Yong-Min[/code][/code]

god im a total noob. i am trying to open my sprites using the RSCD Sprite Editor but all i get is,‘ant’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue. What does that mean??

you dont have apache ant installed, google it

item.title: [Tutorial] Editing EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“drakomy, post:392, topic:274765”]Wow, why isn’t this thread stickied xD
This thread has helped me so damn much.
I was thinking, It would probably be a great idea to add a guide on how to change the client’s resolution (including how to fix the problem’s it causes.)
I personally got it working myself (after a couple hours of trial and error.)
I just think other people would enjoy a guide on this xD.

[Edit] I fixed my other problem but I have a new one, when I try to run the run_editor.bat, it says:

‘ant’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
press any key to continue…

Help please?

search on how to add/change your paths

oh that error is a java a pain only a few people know how to fix it, better re-formate your computer otherwise the error spreads since you already got it.

Lol.[/quote]

By problems it causes, are you referring to the screens and menus etc that need realigning?

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Editing EasyRSC

item.title: [Tutorial] Editing EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @kaspa121 kaspa121
item.description:
@kaspa121 wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:383, topic:274765”][quote author=kaspa121 link=topic=363007.msg3419844#msg3419844 date=1291428806]
Fantastic Thank you sir, Here add my msn we need to talk it will benefit you in every way.

Deanobeanoyee@hotmail.com

Edit Ok were abouts?
[/quote]

Well where abouts in the client do you want it to appear? If you already have some client information, add it in the same place as the other information. I will add your MSN as soon as I log on.[/quote]

ok thanks could you log on quickly please ive been waiting all day for you to log on this website so i can contact you

item.title: [Tutorial] Editing EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

kaspa121:

Fantastic work sir, Just one question HOW do i add Cords to the side of my screen ive tryed all the F hotkeys and nothing Thanks

Add into the Mudclient class:

gameGraphics.drawString("Coords:@yel@ (" + (sectionX + areaX) + ", " + (sectionY + areaY) + ")", i + 5, i1, 1, 0xffffff);

Read full topic
